Inscreva-se em nossos boletins para ser o primeiro a aprender sobre as últimas notícias e muito mais. Vá para 'Entrar' e 'Gerenciar perfil' na parte superior da página. Derramamento de espuma fora do edifício

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= ICC Hits Out at Faf du Plessis Ball-Tampering Appeal Updated: 25 November 2016 10:11 IST Faf Du Plessis was fined his match fee after being caught on camera sucking a sweet, or mint, and rubbing the ball with his saliva in an alleged attempt to alter its flight during last week's second Test against Australia. Reported by Agence France-Presse Read Time: 3 mins Andy Pycroft found Faf du Plessis guilty of ball tampering at an ICC hearing in Adelaide this week AFP Adelaide: The International Cricket Council voiced disappointment on Friday after South Africa skipper Faf du Plessis said he will appeal his conviction for ball-tampering. Du Plessis was fined his match fee after being caught on camera sucking a sweet, or mint, and rubbing the ball with his saliva in an alleged attempt to alter its flight during last week's second Test against Australia. "The ICC is disappointed that Faf du Plessis has chosen not to accept the findings of match referee Andy Pycroft and will instead exercise his right to appeal," the ICC said, adding that an independent Judicial Commissioner will hear the appeal as soon as possible. Cricket South Africa chief executive Haroon Lorgat said in a statement late Thursday that du Plessis's decision was made "after he and his legal team studied the written reasons provided by the match referee". "In his mind Faf is clear that he did not alter the condition of the ball nor did he intend to do so and that the match referee was not correct to find him guilt," Horgat added. "He is understandably feeling aggrieved." Pycroft found du Plessis guilty at an ICC hearing in Adelaide this week. It is the second time he has been fined for ball-tampering, after he was docked 50 percent of his match fee in 2013 in the second Test against Pakistan. But Pycroft said it was treated as a first offence under the version of the ICC's code of conduct that came into force in September. Sunscreen, lip ice, sweets As well as the fine, du Plessis had three demerit points added to his disciplinary record. If he collects another point within 24 months, they will be converted to suspension points and he will be banned. Lorgat said CSA supported the appeal "as there are issues relating to fair and just process, interpretation of the rules, science and performance that need to be considered". In a statement, the ICC reinforced that under the laws of cricket "a player should not use artificial substances to shine the ball". "The ICC understands that to include, but is not limited to, sunscreen, lip ice and residue from sweets," it said. "The ICC does not wish to prevent players from using these substances for legitimate purposes, however, any deliberate attempt to apply such substances to the ball, as was the case here, will not be acceptable." It added that umpires would be instructed to remind all teams of the laws as they stand. "Following the appeal we will review the matter along with our members and the MCC to see if there are any learnings to be taken from this issue," it said. Du Plessis, who put the row behind him to score a gritty century Thursday in the third Test against Australia in Adelaide, has warned authorities have opened a "can of worms". "For me (ball-tampering) is picking the ball, scratching the ball. Shining the ball, I think all cricketers would say, is not in the same place," he said this week. For the latest Sports news like us on Facebook or Follow us on Twitter and get the NDTV Cricket app for Android or iOS Related Articles

"The ICC is disappointed that Faf du Plessis has chosen not to accept the findings of match referee Andy Pycroft and will instead exercise his right to appeal," the ICC said, adding that an independent Judicial Commissioner will hear the appeal as soon as possible. Cricket South Africa chief executive Haroon Lorgat said in a statement late Thursday that du Plessis's decision was made "after he and his legal team studied the written reasons provided by the match referee". "In his mind Faf is clear that he did not alter the condition of the ball nor did he intend to do so and that the match referee was not correct to find him guilt," Horgat added. "He is understandably feeling aggrieved." Pycroft found du Plessis guilty at an ICC hearing in Adelaide this week. It is the second time he has been fined for ball-tampering, after he was docked 50 percent of his match fee in 2013 in the second Test against Pakistan. But Pycroft said it was treated as a first offence under the version of the ICC's code of conduct that came into force in September. Sunscreen, lip ice, sweets As well as the fine, du Plessis had three demerit points added to his disciplinary record. If he collects another point within 24 months, they will be converted to suspension points and he will be banned. Lorgat said CSA supported the appeal "as there are issues relating to fair and just process, interpretation of the rules, science and performance that need to be considered". In a statement, the ICC reinforced that under the laws of cricket "a player should not use artificial substances to shine the ball". "The ICC understands that to include, but is not limited to, sunscreen, lip ice and residue from sweets," it said. "The ICC does not wish to prevent players from using these substances for legitimate purposes, however, any deliberate attempt to apply such substances to the ball, as was the case here, will not be acceptable." It added that umpires would be instructed to remind all teams of the laws as they stand. "Following the appeal we will review the matter along with our members and the MCC to see if there are any learnings to be taken from this issue," it said. Du Plessis, who put the row behind him to score a gritty century Thursday in the third Test against Australia in Adelaide, has warned authorities have opened a "can of worms". "For me (ball-tampering) is picking the ball, scratching the ball. Shining the ball, I think all cricketers would say, is not in the same place," he said this week. For the latest Sports news like us on Facebook or Follow us on Twitter and get the NDTV Cricket app for Android or iOS Related Articles
body: FCC Du Plessis foi multado em sua taxa de jogo depois de ser pego na câmera chupando um doce, ou menta, e esfregando a saliva em uma suposta bola tentativa de alterar seu vôo durante o segundo teste da semana passada contra a Austrália. Reportado por Agence France-Presse Tempo de leitura: 3 minutos Andy Pycroft considerou Faf du Plessis culpado de adulteração de bola em uma audiência da ICC em Adelaide nesta semana AFP Adelaide: O Conselho Internacional de Críquete manifestou decepção na sexta-feira depois que o capitão da África do Sul Faf du Plessis disse que recorrer de sua condenação por adulteração de bola. Du Plessis foi multado em sua taxa de jogo depois de ser pego na câmera chupando um doce ou menta e esfregando a bola com a saliva em uma suposta tentativa de alterar seu vôo durante o segundo teste da semana passada contra a Austrália. "O TPI está desapontado por Faf du Plessis ter escolhido não aceitar as conclusões do juiz Andy Pycroft e, em vez disso, exercer seu direito de apelar", afirmou o TPI, acrescentando que um comissário judicial independente ouvirá o apelo o mais rápido possível. O executivo-chefe da Cricket South Africa, Haroon Lorgat, disse em comunicado na quinta-feira que a decisão de du Plessis foi tomada "depois que ele e sua equipe jurídica estudaram as razões escritas fornecidas pelo árbitro da partida". "Na sua opinião, Faf está claro que ele não alterou a condição da bola nem pretendia fazê-lo e que o árbitro da partida não estava correto em encontrar sua culpa", acrescentou Horgat. "Ele está compreensivelmente sentindo-se ofendido." Pycroft considerou du Plessis culpado em uma audiência da ICC em Adelaide nesta semana. É a segunda vez que ele é multado por adulteração de bola, depois de receber 50% de sua taxa de jogo em 2013 no segundo teste contra o Paquistão. Mas Pycroft disse que foi tratado como uma primeira ofensa sob a versão do código de conduta da ICC que entrou em vigor em setembro. Protetor solar, gelo labial, doces Além da multa, du Plessis teve três pontos de demérito adicionados ao seu registro disciplinar. Se ele coletar outro ponto dentro de 24 meses, eles serão convertidos em pontos de suspensão e ele será banido. Lorgat disse que a CSA apóia o apelo ", pois há questões relacionadas a processos justos e justos, interpretação das regras, ciência e desempenho que precisam ser considerados". Em uma declaração, o TPI reforçou que, de acordo com as leis do críquete, "um jogador não deve usar substâncias artificiais para fazer brilhar a bola". "O TPI entende que isso inclui, mas não se limita a, protetor solar, gelo labial e resíduos de doces", afirmou. "O TPI não deseja impedir que os jogadores usem essas substâncias para fins legítimos, no entanto, qualquer tentativa deliberada de aplicar tais substâncias à bola, como foi o caso aqui, não será aceitável." Acrescentou que os árbitros seriam instruídos a lembrar todas as equipes das leis como estão. "Após a apelação, revisaremos o assunto junto com nossos membros e a MCC para verificar se existem aprendizados a serem tirados desta questão", afirmou o documento. Du Plessis, que colocou a briga atrás dele para marcar um século de coragem nesta quinta-feira no terceiro Teste contra a Austrália em Adelaide, alertou que as autoridades abriram uma "lata de vermes". "Para mim (adulteração de bola) é pegar a bola, arranhá-la. Brincar com a bola, acho que diriam todos os jogadores de cricket, não está no mesmo lugar", disse ele nesta semana. translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= Market News | Thu Nov 10, 2016 | 7:43am EST BRIEF-Zvi Alon to step down as Rada's CEO Nov 10 Rada Electronic Industries Ltd * Zvi Alon to step down as Rada's CEO * Rada Electronic Industries Ltd says Dov Sella, company's current chief business development officer will be replacing Alon, effective immediately Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage: Next In Market News UPDATE 1-U.S. 30-year mortgage rates hit 5-month high - Freddie Mac (Adds background, quote) NEW YORK, Nov 10 The average interest rate on U.S. 30-year fixed-rate mortgages rose to its highest level in five months with rising Treasury yields, mortgage finance agency Freddie Mac said on Thursday. The borrowing cost on 30-year mortgages, the most widely held type of U.S. home loan, averaged 3.57 percent in the week ended Nov. 10. It was the highest since 3.60 percent in the week of June 9. Thirty-year mortgage rates averaged 3.54 perce MORE FROM REUTERS From Around the Web Promoted by Taboola Trending Stories

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= Tracy Scoggins Gilora Rejal was a Cardassian subspace researcher with the Cardassian Science Ministry sent to Deep Space 9 in 2371 to assist the Federation with their plans to install a subspace relay with which to communicate with the Gamma Quadrant . She was accompanied to the station by an academic associate, Ulani Belor . Shortly afterward, they were joined by an operative of the Obsidian Order , Dejar , who posed as another associate. During her work on Deep Space 9 with Chief O'Brien , she was initially irritated by his offers and interest in helping with the modifications required for the project. She repeatedly dismissed him and insultingly questioned the modifications made to the station since the Bajoran Occupation . After being confronted by O'Brien regarding what he perceived to be her speciesism towards the engineering competency of Humans , he was rebuffed upon discovering that her annoyance with him was not as a result of his species, but that he was male – apparently the Cardassian male is stereotyped by his engineering incompetence. After being chided by O'Brien, she discovered that this stereotype was not applicable to the Human male, especially upon learning of the chief's position and observing his exceptional skill. While working to complete the modifications at a later time, Gilora made advances on O'Brien based on his confrontational attitude, that being the "flirtations" of the typical Cardassian male. Uncomfortable and bothered by her actions (particularly her offer to bear "many healthy children"), O'Brien related to her that he already had a healthy child and a wife . Embarrassed that she had misinterpreted his irritability as a result of a "cross-cultural misunderstanding" and by O'Brien's declaration that he was not remotely interested in her, Gilora left the chief to finish the work alone. Later during the mission, while in the Gamma Quadrant, Gilora exposed Dejar's undercover status (as an Obsidian Order operative) on board the USS Defiant , to ensure that Dejar's sabotage was not left attributed to a mistake of O'Brien's. Gilora explained this to O'Brien upon her departure from DS9 to show her appreciation for his skill as an engineer. He in turn appreciated Gilora's courage. Before leaving the station, she told him that his wife was a lucky woman and gave him a kiss on the cheek. ( DS9 : " Destiny ") Gilora Rejal was played by Tracy Scoggins . Scoggins commented: "I loved everything about it. I loved playing an alien. First of all, she was an intelligent alien, a science officer. I like playing aliens because every day is like Halloween when you're doing it. You're free to misbehave. You're free to take license. You might do things that you wouldn't do playing, say, the daughter of a dean. When I did DS9, most of my scenes were with Colm Meaney, and I'm a huge fan of his. And I liked that she had an edge to her. She was smart and had this edge, and yet I also got to be sexy. Nobody cared that she was sexy, but she got to be sexy ". [1] According to the script , Gilora was pronounced as "gih-LORE-ah".

body: Tracy Scoggins Gilora Rejal foi uma pesquisadora do subespaço cardassiano do Ministério da Ciência Cardassian enviada ao Deep Space 9 em 2371 para ajudar a Federação com seus planos de instalar um relé de subespaço com o qual se comunicar com o quadrante gama. Ela foi acompanhada à estação por um associado acadêmico, Ulani Belor. Logo depois, eles se juntaram a um agente da Ordem Obsidiana, Dejar, que se apresentava como outro associado. Durante seu trabalho no Deep Space 9 com o chefe O'Brien, ela ficou inicialmente irritada com as ofertas e o interesse em ajudar com as modificações necessárias para o projeto. Ela o dispensou repetidamente e questionou insultuosamente as modificações feitas na estação desde a Ocupação Bajoran. Depois de ser confrontado por O'Brien em relação ao que ele considerava o especismo dela em relação à competência de engenharia dos seres humanos, ele foi rejeitado ao descobrir que o aborrecimento dela por ele não era resultado de sua espécie, mas que ele era masculino - aparentemente o cardassiano. o homem é estereotipado por sua incompetência em engenharia. Depois de ser repreendida por O'Brien, ela descobriu que esse estereótipo não era aplicável ao homem humano, especialmente ao saber da posição do chefe e observar sua habilidade excepcional. Enquanto trabalhava para concluir as modificações posteriormente, Gilora avançou em O'Brien com base em sua atitude de confronto, que eram os "flertes" do homem cardassiano típico. Desconfortável e incomodado por suas ações (particularmente sua oferta de ter "muitos filhos saudáveis"), O'Brien contou a ela que ele já tinha um filho saudável e uma esposa. Envergonhado por ela ter interpretado mal a irritabilidade dele como resultado de um "mal-entendido transcultural" e pela declaração de O'Brien de que ele não estava interessado remotamente nela, Gilora deixou o chefe para terminar o trabalho sozinho. Mais tarde, durante a missão, enquanto no Quadrante Gama, Gilora expôs o status secreto de Dejar (como um agente da Ordem Obsidiana) a bordo do USS Defiant, para garantir que a sabotagem de Dejar não fosse atribuída a um erro de O'Brien. Gilora explicou isso a O'Brien ao partir do DS9 para mostrar seu apreço por sua habilidade como engenheiro. Por sua vez, ele apreciou a coragem de Gilora. Antes de deixar a delegacia, ela disse que sua esposa era uma mulher de sorte e lhe deu um beijo na bochecha. (DS9: "Destiny") Gilora Rejal foi interpretada por Tracy Scoggins. Scoggins comentou: "Adorei tudo. Adorei interpretar um alienígena. Antes de tudo, ela era uma alienígena inteligente, uma oficial de ciências. Gosto de interpretar alienígenas porque todo dia é como o Dia das Bruxas quando você faz isso. é livre para se comportar mal. Você é livre para tirar licença. Você pode fazer coisas que não faria como, por exemplo, a filha de um reitor. Quando eu fiz o DS9, a maioria das minhas cenas foram com Colm Meaney, e eu sou um grande fã dele. E eu gostei que ela tivesse uma vantagem sobre ela. Ela era inteligente e tinha essa vantagem, e ainda assim eu também fui sexy. Ninguém se importava que ela fosse sexy, mas ela era sexy ". [1] De acordo com o roteiro, Gilora foi pronunciado como "gih-LORE-ah".

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= Hillary’s trying to make the election a referendum on political correctness Donald Trump’s triumph over Hillary Clinton presages an even bigger battle ahead against the heart of the Democratic establishment: the federal workforce. This army of bureaucrats — almost 3 million strong — gave Clinton a large majority of their votes and over 90 percent of their campaign contributions. Expect federal workers and their union bosses to use every trick in the book to block Trump’s reform agenda. Trump’s ability to fix the Department of Veterans Affairs, clean up IRS abuses, rollback job-killing regulations and get taxpayers their money’s worth all hinge on uprooting the entrenched civil service. Newt Gingrich, a top Trump advisor, warns: “If you don’t fix this problem, nothing in government is going to work.” That’s a tall order. The bureaucracy generally has a vise-like grip on the executive branch — presidents come and go, but the bureaucrats remain. Public unions are already digging in for a fight. After the election, J. David Cox, president of the American Federation of Government Employees, dismissed Trump’s plans as more or less irrelevant. AFGE members have their own big-government agenda, and “that never changes no matter who sits in the White House.” Protection of the status quo at any cost. Even deaths. Thousands of sick vets died at VA hospitals because of employee self-dealing. Bureaucrats doctored the medical waitlists to earn bonuses while vets languished without care. Despite Congress enacting “reforms” and President Obama appointing a new VA secretary in 2014, the bureaucracy continues to block giving vets access to civilian care. How hard is it to fire anyone at Veterans Affairs? One surgeon found guilty of abandoning a patient on the operating table and leaving the medical center still got an $11,000 bonus. As a candidate, Trump promised to make swift changes. Exit polls show military families voted for him 2-1 over Clinton. Dan Caldwell of Concerned Veterans for America says he’s encouraged to see civil-service reform at the top of Trump’s agenda. The same changes needed to turn around the VA have to be made across all federal departments. Right now, workers found guilty of serious misdeeds like tax evasion, watching porn on the job or fraudulent collection of unemployment benefits typically keep their jobs and get bonuses. Firing requires so many months of documentation, hearings and appeals that bosses decide it’s not worth the trouble. No-show jobs are rampant, costing $1 billion a year. Supervisors ignore the waste, and just hire someone else to get the work done. Breaking up the federal-employee protection racket will require muscle from Congress and the Department of Justice. Obama’s DOJ obstructed efforts to fire wrongdoers and incompetents. Now, with the White House and Congress under Republican control, taxpayers have a fighting chance. A bipartisan VA reform bill with real teeth has already passed the House and is ready for Senate action. It will shorten the process for firing and demoting senior VA personnel, even eliminating appeals to the misnamed Merit Systems Protection Board, which protects criminals and deadwood, not merit. Count on fierce opposition from union-funded pols like Sens. Bernie Sanders (D. Vt.) and Richard Blumenthal (D. Conn.), who gutted previous efforts to hold VA employees accountable. Will Trump, a newcomer to Washington, succeed where other presidents have failed? Possibly. He’s shown he gets his money’s worth. After all, he defeated spendthrift Clinton with less than a quarter of the campaign staff and half the spending. But federal employees will scramble to stay on the gravy train. They earn a whopping $123,160 a year on average — about a third more than private-sector employees — get over a month’s paid vacation and don’t lose sleep over getting fired. Hard to call them civil “servants.” Obama hiked their pay, and Clinton promised to give them even more, after which she happily received their votes. One hand washes the other. Trump understands who should be calling the shots in Washington, DC: not federal bureaucrats but the taxpayers who cover their salaries. Betsy McCaughey is a senior fellow at the London Center for Policy Research. Share this:

body: A tentativa de Hillary de fazer da eleição um referendo sobre o politicamente correto o triunfo de Donald Trump sobre Hillary Clinton pressupõe uma batalha ainda maior pela frente contra o coração do establishment democrata: a força de trabalho federal. Esse exército de burocratas - quase três milhões - deu a Clinton uma grande maioria de seus votos e mais de 90% de suas contribuições à campanha. Espere que os funcionários federais e seus chefes sindicais usem todos os truques do livro para bloquear a agenda de reformas de Trump. A capacidade de Trump de consertar o Departamento de Assuntos dos Veteranos, limpar os abusos do IRS, reverter os regulamentos de abstenção de empregos e fazer com que os contribuintes valham o dinheiro todo dependem da remoção do serviço público entrincheirado. Newt Gingrich, um dos principais conselheiros de Trump, alerta: "Se você não resolver esse problema, nada no governo funcionará". Essa é uma tarefa difícil. A burocracia geralmente tem um controle semelhante ao do poder executivo - os presidentes vêm e vão, mas os burocratas permanecem. Os sindicatos já estão se preparando para uma luta. Após a eleição, J. David Cox, presidente da Federação Americana de Funcionários do Governo, descartou os planos de Trump como mais ou menos irrelevantes. Os membros do AFGE têm sua própria agenda de grandes governos e "isso nunca muda, não importa quem esteja na Casa Branca". Proteção do status quo a qualquer custo. Até mortes. Milhares de veterinários doentes morreram em hospitais do VA por causa de auto-tratamento de funcionários. Os burocratas manipulavam as listas de espera médicas para ganhar bônus, enquanto os veterinários permaneciam sem cuidados. Apesar de o Congresso ter promulgado "reformas" e o presidente Obama ter nomeado um novo secretário de VA em 2014, a burocracia continua impedindo o acesso dos veterinários aos cuidados civis. Quão difícil é demitir alguém da Veterans Affairs? Um cirurgião considerado culpado de abandonar um paciente na mesa de operações e deixar o centro médico ainda recebeu um bônus de US $ 11.000. Como candidato, Trump prometeu fazer mudanças rápidas. As pesquisas de saída mostram que as famílias militares votaram nele por 2-1 sobre Clinton. Dan Caldwell, do Veterans em causa para a América, diz que é encorajado a ver a reforma do serviço público no topo da agenda de Trump. As mesmas mudanças necessárias para mudar o VA devem ser feitas em todos os departamentos federais. No momento, os trabalhadores considerados culpados de crimes graves, como sonegação de impostos, assistir pornografia no trabalho ou cobrança fraudulenta de benefícios de desemprego, normalmente mantêm seus empregos e recebem bônus. A demissão requer tantos meses de documentação, audiências e recursos que os chefes decidem que não vale a pena. Empregos no show são galopantes, custando US $ 1 bilhão por ano. Os supervisores ignoram o desperdício e apenas contratam alguém para fazer o trabalho. Quebrar a raquete de proteção dos funcionários federais exigirá força do Congresso e do Departamento de Justiça. O Departamento de Justiça de Obama obstruiu os esforços para demitir infratores e incompetentes. Agora, com a Casa Branca e o Congresso sob controle republicano, os contribuintes têm uma chance de lutar. Um projeto de reforma bipartidário da VA com dentes reais já passou na Câmara e está pronto para a ação do Senado. Reduzirá o processo de demissão e rebaixamento de funcionários seniores da VA, até mesmo eliminando apelos ao Conselho de Proteção de Mérito de Sistemas de Mérito, que protege criminosos e madeira morta, e não mérito. Conte com uma oposição feroz de políticos financiados pelo sindicato, como os senadores Bernie Sanders (D. Vt.) E Richard Blumenthal (D. Conn.), Que estriparam os esforços anteriores para responsabilizar os funcionários da VA. Será que Trump, um recém-chegado a Washington, terá sucesso onde outros presidentes falharam? Possivelmente. Ele mostrou que ganha o dinheiro. Afinal, ele derrotou Clinton com menos de um quarto da equipe da campanha e metade dos gastos. Mas os funcionários federais se esforçam para permanecer no molho de molho. Eles ganham 123.160 dólares por ano em média - cerca de um terço a mais do que os funcionários do setor privado - recebem mais de um mês de férias pagas e não perdem o sono por serem demitidos. Difícil chamá-los de "servidores" civis. Obama aumentou seu salário, e Clinton prometeu dar-lhes ainda mais, após o que ela recebeu alegremente seus votos. Uma mão lava a outra. Trump entende quem deve dar as ordens em Washington, DC: não os burocratas federais, mas os contribuintes que cobrem seus salários. Betsy McCaughey é bolsista sênior do London Center for Policy Research. Compartilhar isso:

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= JMuse As the nation wakes up eagerly each morning to strike another day off the “how long until the election is over” calendar, it seems few can contain their excitement at the prospect of Nov. 9. There is, however, one sad reality that accompanies this momentous event: our eventual farewell to the political powerhouse that has occupied the White House since 2008. And, while we’ll miss you Barack , we’re really talking about Michelle Obama and how difficult it will be to say goodbye to the First Lady of our dreams come January 2017. Whether you were riveted by her speech that perfectly laid bare the dangerous way Trump treats women , or blown away by her ability to rap Missy Elliott lyrics, no sweat . Or ― that dress . Michelle is sure doing all she can to make this bon voyage a painful one. Thankfully, an artist by the name of J. Muse just summed up all our happy-sad feelings with this stunner of a portrait of the one and only FLOTUS. The teacher teaches the student a lesson. Once the lesson is learned the student has all the tools needed to move forward. I am my own artist. Thank you my love for all you have taught me!! Title: F.L.O.T.U.S. Size: 24x36 Medium: Acrylic DM if interested in purchasing my first original painting #artist #painter #blackartist #flotus #michelleobama A photo posted by J. Muse (@j.muse) on Oct 20, 2016 at 5:31pm PDT The image, based off Obama’s recent spread in The New York Times Style Magazine , captures Michelle looking all kinds of stunning. But of course, it’s about much more than that. “I selected FLOTUS as an artistic subject because Michelle Obama represents a woman of empowerment for the black community,” J. Muse explained in an email to The Huffington Post. “In a world where odds are against us, she rises to the platform and takes a stand for each and every black woman or little black girl. She promotes health, wellness, and strength. Those qualities inspire me to keep pushing forward in my art career.” J. Muse’s wife, Adrienne (Madam) Muse, taught the budding artist how to paint just a year ago. Inspired by her partner’s use of color to bring her subjects to life, J. Muse felt she wanted her first large piece to capture something, or someone, important. PRINTS NOW AVAILABLE!!!www.MadamMuse.LA(Link in Bio) #BlackGirlMagic #MichelleObama #TSRArt #dopeart #supportblackbusiness #supportblackartists #Jmuse #MadamMuse PRINTS ARE WITH OR WITHOUT FRAME A photo posted by J. Muse (@j.muse) on Oct 24, 2016 at 12:04pm PDT “When I saw the T Magazine’s spread, I instantly thought, ‘Wow can she be president please?’” J. Muse said. “I just feel sad that the Obamas are leaving office. I wanted to immortalize the First Lady and the leadership she possesses. The expression in her face just oozes black girl magic!” These last couple of weeks leading up to election day are sure to come with lots of nail biting, eye rolling, Twitter ranting, and stress eating. But we’re counting on J. Muse’s portrait to remind us that, even in these darkest of times, when we have a leader as thoughtful, strong, compassionate and all around queenly as Michelle, we’re doing OK. “I want viewers of this piece to feel my own artistic style that I chose to express Michelle Obama,” J. Muse said. “In the many ways that she has changed the world as the First Lady of the United States, she has definitely impacted my life to follow my dreams and accomplish all that I desire to achieve.” #MichelleForPresident already. According to Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie (@chimamanda.adichie), "she had the air of a woman who could balance a checkbook, and who knew a good deal when she saw it, and who would tell off whomever needed telling off." @gloriasteinem told us how "she managed to convey dignity and humor at the same time." Jon Meacham described how both she and her husband "conducted themselves splendidly in the @whitehouse, managing the most difficult of tasks with apparent ease." @rashidajones said that she'll "have her own legacy, separate from her husband's. And it will be that she was the first lady to show women that they don’t have to choose. That it’s okay to be everything." Visit tmagazine.com to read more from these love letters, all penned to the First Lady @MichelleObama, one of our seven #tgreats. Photo by @collierschorrstudio. A photo posted by T: The NYTimes Style Magazine (@tmagazine) on Oct 17, 2016 at 5:57pm PDT Also on HuffPost Michelle Obama's 52 Best Outfits Michelle Obama's 52 Best Outfits 1 of 52 2008 Share this slide: Getty Images More: Michelle Obama Female Artists Flotus J.muse Suggest a correction 146 Comments

body: JMuse Enquanto o país acorda ansiosamente todas as manhãs para tirar outro dia de folga do calendário "quanto tempo até a eleição terminar", parece que poucos conseguem conter sua empolgação com a perspectiva de 9 de novembro. No entanto, existe uma triste realidade que acompanha este momento importante: nossa eventual despedida da potência política que ocupa a Casa Branca desde 2008. E, enquanto sentiremos sua falta, Barack, estamos realmente falando de Michelle Obama e de quão difícil será dizer adeus ao A primeira-dama dos nossos sonhos chega em janeiro de 2017. Se você ficou fascinado com o discurso dela que revelou claramente a maneira perigosa como Trump trata as mulheres, ou se impressionou com a capacidade de cantar as letras de Missy Elliott, não se preocupe. Ou - aquele vestido. Michelle tem certeza de que está fazendo tudo o que pode para tornar essa boa viagem dolorosa. Felizmente, um artista chamado J. Muse acabou de resumir todos os nossos sentimentos de tristeza e alegria com este impressionante retrato de um dos únicos FLOTUS. O professor ensina ao aluno uma lição. Uma vez que a lição é aprendida, o aluno tem todas as ferramentas necessárias para avançar. Eu sou meu próprio artista. Obrigado meu amor por tudo que você me ensinou !! Título: F.L.O.T.U.S. Tamanho: 24x36 Médio: Acrílico DM, se estiver interessado em comprar minha primeira pintura original , baseado na recente divulgação de Obama na The New York Times Style Magazine, captura Michelle com uma aparência impressionante. Mas é claro, é muito mais do que isso. "Selecionei FLOTUS como um tema artístico, porque Michelle Obama representa uma mulher de poder para a comunidade negra", explicou J. Muse em um e-mail ao The Huffington Post. “Em um mundo em que as probabilidades estão contra nós, ela sobe para a plataforma e defende todas as mulheres negras ou menininhas negras. Ela promove saúde, bem-estar e força. Essas qualidades me inspiram a seguir em frente na minha carreira artística. ” A esposa de J. Muse, Adrienne (Madam) Muse, ensinou o artista iniciante a pintar apenas um ano atrás. Inspirada pelo uso da cor de seu parceiro para dar vida aos seus objetos, J. Muse sentiu que queria que sua primeira peça grande capturasse algo, ou alguém, importante. Www.MadamMuse.LA (Link in Bio) ) em 24 de outubro de 2016 às 12:04 PDT “Quando vi a divulgação da T Magazine, pensei instantaneamente: 'Uau, ela pode ser presidente, por favor?'”, disse J. Muse. “Só me sinto triste por os Obamas estarem deixando o cargo. Eu queria imortalizar a primeira-dama e a liderança que ela possui. A expressão em seu rosto apenas exala magia negra! As últimas semanas que antecederam o dia das eleições certamente virão com muitas mordidas de unhas, revirar os olhos, reclamações no Twitter e comer estresse. Mas estamos contando com o retrato de J. Muse para nos lembrar que, mesmo nos tempos mais sombrios, quando temos um líder tão atencioso, forte, compassivo e de rainha como Michelle, estamos indo bem. "Quero que os espectadores desta peça sintam meu próprio estilo artístico que escolhi para expressar Michelle Obama", disse J. Muse. "Nas várias maneiras em que ela mudou o mundo como a primeira-dama dos Estados Unidos, ela definitivamente impactou minha vida para seguir meus sonhos e realizar tudo o que desejo alcançar". #MichelleForPresident já. De acordo com Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie (@ chimamanda.adichie), "ela tinha o ar de uma mulher que conseguia equilibrar um talão de cheques, e que sabia muito quando o via e que denunciava quem precisasse ser denunciado". @gloriasteinem nos contou como "ela conseguiu transmitir dignidade e humor ao mesmo tempo". Jon Meacham descreveu como ela e o marido "se comportaram esplendidamente no @whitehouse, gerenciando as tarefas mais difíceis com aparente facilidade". @rashidajones disse que "terá seu próprio legado, separado do marido. E será que ela foi a primeira dama a mostrar às mulheres que elas não precisam escolher. Que não há problema em ser tudo". Visite tmagazine.com para ler mais sobre essas cartas de amor, todas escritas para a Primeira Dama @MichelleObama, uma de nossas sete #tgreats. Foto por @collierschorrstudio. Uma foto postada por T: The NYTimes Style Magazine (@tmagazine) em 17 de outubro de 2016 às 17:57 PDT Também no HuffPost As 52 melhores roupas de Michelle Obama As 52 melhores roupas de Michelle Obama 1 de 52 2008 Compartilhe este slide: Getty Images Mais: Michelle Artistas do sexo feminino Obama Flotus J.muse Sugerir uma correção 146 Comentários

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= (AP Images) The election of Donald Trump as the next US president filled many Americans with a sense of uncertainty. As the holiday shopping seasons kicks off with Black Friday, the country is about to get an answer to a crucial question: what happens to the retail industry now that Trump has been elected? This year, sales in the holiday shopping season of November and December, excluding cars, gas, and restaurant sales, are expected to hit $655.8 billion, the National Retail Federation reported in October. That's an increase from $626.1 billion in sales last year. However, this prediction was made a month before Election Day. With Donald Trump's win, there have been concerns on how the president-elect will impact shoppers' behavior. Prior to the election, many said Trump's unpredictable nature would be bad news for the economy. Citigroup went as far to predict that a Trump victory could cause a global recession. These concerns followed Trump after Election Day. Soon after the election, analysts told CNBC that a Trump win creates an atmosphere of uncertainty, especially among upper-class shoppers who tend to be big spenders, something that could hurt holiday sales. Because the election was so divisive, Hillary Clinton supporters were expected to spend less this year. Despite early concerns, signs are pointing towards a successful start to the holiday shopping season — one of the first major tests Donald Trump needs to pass if he wants to fulfill his promise to grow the American economy. (Hayley Peterson/Business Insider) Black Friday may be decreasing in importance, but the NRF found that 137.4 million people were planning or considering shopping during Thanksgiving weekend this year, an increase from last year's 135.8 million people. And, some retailers are already celebrating, with Target's CEO saying on Thursday evening that Thanksgiving may be the retailer's biggest online shopping day of all time. Some economists are theorizing America's economic boost since Trump's election is not due to which candidate won. Instead, they're connecting growth to a sense of relief that the election is finally over — something that the NRF says is likely to put Americans in the mood to shop deals. For retailers, the reasons behind a successful holiday season are less important than that people actually buy their products. A successful Black Friday signifies a promising start to the most important wonderful time of the year — at least when it comes to retail sales. NOW WATCH: 7 things you shouldn’t buy on Black Friday More From Business Insider We went to Walmart for Black Friday — and it was nothing like we expected Best Buy’s Black Friday deals are kicking off on Thanksgiving Day Target's Black Friday is kicking off two days early

body: (AP Images) A ​​eleição de Donald Trump como o próximo presidente dos EUA encheu muitos americanos com uma sensação de incerteza. À medida que a temporada de compras natalinas começa com a Black Friday, o país está prestes a receber uma resposta para uma pergunta crucial: o que acontece com o setor de varejo agora que Trump foi eleito? Este ano, as vendas na temporada de compras natalinas de novembro e dezembro, excluindo vendas de carros, gás e restaurantes, devem atingir US $ 655,8 bilhões, informou a Federação Nacional de Varejo em outubro. Isso representa um aumento de US $ 626,1 bilhões em vendas no ano passado. No entanto, essa previsão foi feita um mês antes do dia das eleições. Com a vitória de Donald Trump, houve preocupações sobre como o presidente eleito afetará o comportamento dos compradores. Antes da eleição, muitos disseram que a natureza imprevisível de Trump seria uma má notícia para a economia. O Citigroup chegou ao ponto de prever que uma vitória de Trump poderia causar uma recessão global. Essas preocupações seguiram Trump após o dia das eleições. Logo após a eleição, analistas disseram à CNBC que uma vitória de Trump cria uma atmosfera de incerteza, especialmente entre os compradores da classe alta que tendem a ser grandes gastadores, algo que pode prejudicar as vendas de fim de ano. Como a eleição foi muito divergente, os apoiadores de Hillary Clinton deveriam gastar menos este ano. Apesar das preocupações iniciais, os sinais estão apontando para um início bem-sucedido da temporada de compras natalinas - um dos primeiros grandes testes que Donald Trump precisa passar se quiser cumprir sua promessa de crescer a economia americana. (Hayley Peterson / Business Insider) A Black Friday pode estar diminuindo em importância, mas a NRF constatou que 137,4 milhões de pessoas estavam planejando ou considerando fazer compras durante o fim de semana de Ação de Graças deste ano, um aumento em relação às 135,8 milhões de pessoas do ano passado. E alguns varejistas já estão comemorando, com o CEO da Target dizendo na quinta-feira à noite que o Dia de Ação de Graças pode ser o maior dia de compras on-line do varejista de todos os tempos. Alguns economistas estão teorizando o impulso econômico dos EUA desde que a eleição de Trump não se deve a qual candidato venceu. Em vez disso, eles estão conectando o crescimento a uma sensação de alívio pelo fato de as eleições finalmente terem terminado - algo que a NRF diz que provavelmente colocará os americanos no clima para fazer negócios. Para os varejistas, as razões por trás de uma temporada de férias bem-sucedida são menos importantes do que as pessoas realmente compram seus produtos. Uma sexta-feira negra bem-sucedida significa um começo promissor para a época maravilhosa mais importante do ano - pelo menos quando se trata de vendas no varejo. AGORA ASSISTA: 7 coisas que você não deve comprar na Black Friday Mais do Business Insider Fomos ao Walmart para a Black Friday - e não era nada como esperávamos que as ofertas da Black Friday da Best Buy estivessem começando no Dia de Ação de Graças A Black Friday da Target está começando duas dias cedo

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump are deadlocked in the first ABC News/Washington Post daily tracking poll conducted entirely after FBI Director James Comey informed Congress about additional evidence related to Clinton’s use of a private email server while secretary of state, though the resurgence of Clinton's email scandal has had little impact on the race. The poll, which includes interviews conducted last Friday through Monday, shows Clinton and Trump both at 46 percent. Libertarian Gary Johnson is at 3 percent, Green Party nominee Jill Stein is at 2 percent and another 3 percent are undecided. Story Continued Below The race has tightened significantly since the tracking poll began last month. In the first four nights of the poll — the four nights immediately following the final televised debate between the two major-party candidates — Clinton had a 12-point lead over Trump, 50 percent to 38 percent. But that narrowed almost immediately, and in the following four nights, October 24-27, Clinton’s lead was down to just 2 points. The good news for Clinton is the race has not changed significantly since Comey’s letter to Congress brought her email scandal back into the news. Clinton lost just one point in between the four days immediately preceding Comey’s letter and the following four-day period, while Trump gained a point. Clinton and Trump are now winning equal percentages of Democrats and Republicans, respectively. Both capture 85 percent of voters who identify with their respective parties, including independents who lean toward one party over the other. While the race hasn’t significantly tightened as a result of Comey’s letter, voters’ expectations have been altered. The percentage of likely voters who expect Clinton to win has declined to 55 percent, down from 60 percent immediately before the letter. That has not led to a significant uptick in the percentage of voters who think Trump will win, 31 percent, up from 29 percent before the letter. And Clinton has taken a significant hit on honesty in the wake of the most recent revelations. Asked which candidate is more honest and trustworthy, 46 percent pick Trump, and 38 percent say Clinton. The last time ABC News and the Washington Post asked this survey question, in early September, voters were evenly split between the two candidates, with the two candidates even at 45 percent on the question of who is more honest. While Clinton has slid 7 points since then, Trump has gained little. The poll surveyed 1,182 likely voters and has a margin of error of plus or minus 3 percentage points.

body: Compartilhar no Facebook Compartilhar no Twitter Hillary Clinton e Donald Trump estão em um impasse na primeira pesquisa diária de rastreamento do ABC News / Washington Post, realizada inteiramente depois que o diretor do FBI James Comey informou o Congresso sobre evidências adicionais relacionadas ao uso de Clinton de um servidor de e-mail privado enquanto secretário de Estado, embora o ressurgimento do escândalo por e-mail de Clinton tenha tido pouco impacto na corrida. A pesquisa, que inclui entrevistas realizadas na última sexta-feira a segunda-feira, mostra Clinton e Trump ambos com 46%. O libertário Gary Johnson está em 3%, a indicada ao Partido Verde Jill Stein está em 2% e outros 3% estão indecisos. A história continua abaixo A corrida aumentou significativamente desde que a pesquisa de rastreamento começou no mês passado. Nas primeiras quatro noites da pesquisa - as quatro noites imediatamente após o debate final na televisão entre os dois principais candidatos do partido - Clinton teve uma vantagem de 12 pontos sobre Trump, de 50% a 38%. Mas isso diminuiu quase imediatamente, e nas quatro noites seguintes, de 24 a 27 de outubro, a vantagem de Clinton caiu para apenas 2 pontos. A boa notícia para Clinton é que a corrida não mudou significativamente desde que a carta de Comey ao Congresso trouxe seu escândalo por e-mail de volta às notícias. Clinton perdeu apenas um ponto entre os quatro dias imediatamente anteriores à carta de Comey e o período de quatro dias seguinte, enquanto Trump ganhou um ponto. Clinton e Trump agora estão ganhando porcentagens iguais de democratas e republicanos, respectivamente. Ambos capturam 85% dos eleitores que se identificam com seus respectivos partidos, incluindo os independentes que se inclinam para um partido sobre o outro. Embora a corrida não tenha se reduzido significativamente como resultado da carta de Comey, as expectativas dos eleitores foram alteradas. A porcentagem de prováveis ​​eleitores que esperam que Clinton vença caiu para 55%, abaixo dos 60% imediatamente antes da carta. Isso não levou a um aumento significativo na porcentagem de eleitores que pensam que Trump vencerá, 31%, acima dos 29% anteriores à carta. E Clinton sofreu um golpe significativo na honestidade após as revelações mais recentes. Questionados sobre qual candidato é mais honesto e confiável, 46% escolhem Trump e 38% dizem Clinton. Na última vez em que o ABC News e o Washington Post fizeram essa pergunta, no início de setembro, os eleitores foram divididos igualmente entre os dois candidatos, com os dois candidatos chegando a 45% sobre quem é mais honesto. Enquanto Clinton perdeu 7 pontos desde então, Trump ganhou pouco. A pesquisa entrevistou 1.182 prováveis ​​eleitores e tem uma margem de erro de mais ou menos 3 pontos percentuais.

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= Alibaba’s Lazada Buys Singapore Web Grocer Backed by Saverin Yoolim Lee Nov 02, 2016 11:14 pm ET (Bloomberg) -- Lazada Group SA has agreed to buy Singaporean online grocer RedMart, in the latest expansion for Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. beyond its Chinese home turf. Lazada, which Alibaba took control of this year in its largest overseas acquisition to date, said RedMart will continue to operate independently but the pair will share technology and operational infrastructure. It didn’t disclose the terms of the deal, which it expects to close before the end of 2016. RedMart -- backed by Facebook Inc. billionaire co-founder Eduardo Saverin -- was said to have sought a buyer to help it fend off intensifying competition in its home city. The startup, which delivers products ranging from fresh dragonfruit to frozen dumplings, was said to have reached out to potential buyers including Singaporean supermarket chain NTUC Fairprice Co-operative Ltd. to gauge their interest. The Singapore company founded in 2011 had raised tens of millions of dollars from investors including Garena, Southeast Asia’s biggest tech startup, Saverin and SoftBank Ventures Korea. Lazada’s acquisition gives Alibaba another important asset in a key international market, as it begins to expand its core e-commerce business beyond China. --With assistance from Joyce Koh To contact the reporter on this story: Yoolim Lee in Singapore at yoolim@bloomberg.net. To contact the editors responsible for this story: Robert Fenner at rfenner@bloomberg.net, Edwin Chan, Reed Stevenson ©2016 Bloomberg L.P.
pre_translation_body: Alibaba’s Lazada Buys Singapore Web Grocer Backed by Saverin Yoolim Lee Nov 02, 2016 11:14 pm ET (Bloomberg) -- Lazada Group SA has agreed to buy Singaporean online grocer RedMart, in the latest expansion for Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. beyond its Chinese home turf. Lazada, which Alibaba took control of this year in its largest overseas acquisition to date, said RedMart will continue to operate independently but the pair will share technology and operational infrastructure. It didn’t disclose the terms of the deal, which it expects to close before the end of 2016. RedMart -- backed by Facebook Inc. billionaire co-founder Eduardo Saverin -- was said to have sought a buyer to help it fend off intensifying competition in its home city. The startup, which delivers products ranging from fresh dragonfruit to frozen dumplings, was said to have reached out to potential buyers including Singaporean supermarket chain NTUC Fairprice Co-operative Ltd. to gauge their interest. The Singapore company founded in 2011 had raised tens of millions of dollars from investors including Garena, Southeast Asia’s biggest tech startup, Saverin and SoftBank Ventures Korea. Lazada’s acquisition gives Alibaba another important asset in a key international market, as it begins to expand its core e-commerce business beyond China. --With assistance from Joyce Koh To contact the reporter on this story: Yoolim Lee in Singapore at yoolim@bloomberg.net. To contact the editors responsible for this story: Robert Fenner at rfenner@bloomberg.net, Edwin Chan, Reed Stevenson ©2016 Bloomberg L.P.
body: Lazada compra Alojaba Singapore Web Grocer com apoio de Saverin Yoolim Lee 02 de novembro de 2016 23:14 ET (Bloomberg) - Lazada Group SA concordou em comprar a mercearia on-line de Singapura RedMart, na mais recente expansão da Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. além de seus chineses relva em casa. A Lazada, que a Alibaba assumiu o controle deste ano em sua maior aquisição no exterior até o momento, disse que a RedMart continuará operando de forma independente, mas o par compartilhará tecnologia e infraestrutura operacional. Não divulgou os termos do acordo, que espera fechar antes do final de 2016. Diz-se que o RedMart - apoiado pelo co-fundador do bilionário do Facebook Inc. Eduardo Saverin - procurou um comprador para ajudá-lo a se defender. intensificando a concorrência em sua cidade natal. Dizia-se que a startup, que oferece produtos que variam de frutas-dragão frescas a bolinhos congelados, alcançou potenciais compradores, incluindo a rede de supermercados de Cingapura NTUC Fairprice Co-operative Ltd. para avaliar seu interesse. A empresa de Cingapura fundada em 2011 havia captado dezenas de milhões de dólares de investidores, incluindo Garena, a maior startup de tecnologia do sudeste asiático, Saverin e SoftBank Ventures Korea. A aquisição da Lazada oferece ao Alibaba outro ativo importante em um importante mercado internacional, pois começa a expandir seu negócio principal de comércio eletrônico para além da China. --Com a ajuda de Joyce Koh Para entrar em contato com o repórter sobre esta história: Yoolim Lee, em Cingapura, pelo e-mail yoolim@bloomberg.net. Para entrar em contato com os editores responsáveis ​​pela história: Robert Fenner, rfenner@bloomberg.net, Edwin Chan, Reed Stevenson © 2016 Bloomberg L.P.

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= PITTSBURGH (AP) — Police in the Pittsburgh suburbs say they're investigating a woman's claims that an Uber driver made unwanted sexual advances. Ross Township police say the woman reported the incident about 8:45 p.m. Tuesday. The woman says the driver started making advances while driving her to a restaurant. The driver allegedly stopped the vehicle, but the woman says she pushed him a way and he continued the ride to the restaurant where she got out and called 911. Police say the woman wasn't physically harmed. Investigators are getting a search warrant to obtain driver and trip information from Uber. Uber is a ride-sharing service in which people hire drivers using a smartphone application. The drivers use their personal vehicles when giving people rides.
pre_translation_body: PITTSBURGH (AP) — Police in the Pittsburgh suburbs say they're investigating a woman's claims that an Uber driver made unwanted sexual advances. Ross Township police say the woman reported the incident about 8:45 p.m. Tuesday. The woman says the driver started making advances while driving her to a restaurant. The driver allegedly stopped the vehicle, but the woman says she pushed him a way and he continued the ride to the restaurant where she got out and called 911. Police say the woman wasn't physically harmed. Investigators are getting a search warrant to obtain driver and trip information from Uber. Uber is a ride-sharing service in which people hire drivers using a smartphone application. The drivers use their personal vehicles when giving people rides.
body: PITTSBURGH (AP) - A polícia dos subúrbios de Pittsburgh diz que está investigando as alegações de uma mulher de que um motorista do Uber fez avanços sexuais indesejados. A polícia de Ross Township diz que a mulher relatou o incidente por volta das 20h45. Terça. A mulher diz que o motorista começou a avançar enquanto a levava a um restaurante. O motorista supostamente parou o veículo, mas a mulher diz que o empurrou e ele continuou o caminho até o restaurante onde saiu e ligou para o 911. A polícia diz que a mulher não foi fisicamente prejudicada. Os investigadores estão recebendo um mandado de busca para obter informações sobre motorista e viagem do Uber. O Uber é um serviço de compartilhamento de viagens, no qual as pessoas contratam motoristas usando um aplicativo para smartphone. Os motoristas usam seus veículos pessoais ao dar carona às pessoas.

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= All India | Press Trust of India | Updated: November 05, 2016 22:25 IST EMAIL COMMENTS Centre decared that Assam's "disturbed area" status, in force since 1990, will continue. New Delhi: Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act or AFSPA has been extended in entire Assam and the 20km-wide belt in Meghalaya bordering the state by six months with the Centre declaring that the "disturbed area" status, which has been in force since 1990, will continue.In a notification, the Home Ministry said the law and order situation in Assam has continued to be a matter of concern due to the violent incidents by underground outfits and during January-September 2016, different militant groups were involved in 66 incidents of violence in Assam which resulted in killing of 29 people."The militant outfits operating in the area continue to have been making constant efforts to regroup, re-strengthen and intensified their efforts for recruitment/infiltration of new cadres into the state and indulging in coercive extortion targeting businessmen, tea garden owners, contractors, commercial vehicles, timber smugglers, transporters and even government officials and politicians."United National Liberation Front of Western South East Asia (UNLFW) has been formed in April, 2015, and two of its constituents namely ULFA(I) and NDFB(S) have been desperately making efforts to perpetrate demonstrative acts of violence and during the current year they have been responsible for 57 per cent of the incidents of violence and 84 per cent of the deaths in the state, the notification, issued by Joint Secretary in the Home Ministry Satyendra Garg, said.NDFB(S) militants shot dead 14 civilians and injured 19 others in a busy local market on the outskirts of Kokrajhar town on August 5, 2016, while ULFA(I) cadres also shot dead two Hindi-speaking persons in Tinsukia district and orchestrated five and two IED explosions in Tinsukia and Charaideo districts, respectively, on August 12, 2016."Now, therefore, the entire state of Assam and the 20 kms wide belt in the State of Meghalaya bordering Assam shall continue to be 'disturbed area' under Section 3 of the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act, 1958 up to six months beyond November 3, 2016, unless withdrawn earlier," it said.The central government had first imposed the Armed Forces (Special Powers) Act -- AFSPA -- in Assam by declaring the entire state as "disturbed area" on November 27, 1990 when insurgency led by ULFA was at its peak.The then Prafulla Kumar Mahanta-led Asom Gana Parishad or AGP government was subsequently dismissed by the Centre and the President's rule was imposed.The Home Ministry's gazette notification said ULFA(I) is coordinating joint action with other underground outfits, including NSCN(K) and KYKL, along Arunachal Pradesh-Myanmar border and with GNLA and HNLC along Meghalaya-Bangladesh border also providing training to cadres of KPLT/UPLA in its camps in Myanmar.The Karbi militant outfits namely UPLA, UKPLA and various factions of KPLT have been actively involved in extortion and kidnapping for ransom in the hill districts of Karbi Anglong and Dima Hasao; and the hilly and densely forested border areas of Assam provide an apt location for camps/shelters/ hideouts to ULFA(I), NDFB(S), NSCN(IM), NSCN(K), GNLA KPLT and several Meitei underground outfits and cadres of these outfits take advantage of crossing over to neighbouring states in order to evade security forces actions, it said. Trending

"disturbed area" status, which has been in force since 1990, will continue.In a notification, the Home Ministry said the law and order situation in Assam has continued to be a matter of concern due to the violent incidents by underground outfits and during January-September 2016, different militant groups were involved in 66 incidents of violence in Assam which resulted in killing of 29 people."The militant outfits operating in the area continue to have been making constant efforts to regroup, re-strengthen and intensified their efforts for recruitment/infiltration of new cadres into the state and indulging in coercive extortion targeting businessmen, tea garden owners, contractors, commercial vehicles, timber smugglers, transporters and even government officials and politicians."United body: Toda a Índia | Imprensa Confiança da Índia | Atualizado: 5 de novembro de 2016 22:25 COMENTÁRIOS DO EMAIL DO IST O Centro declarou que o status de "área perturbada" de Assam, em vigor desde 1990, continuará. Nova Délhi: A Lei das Forças Armadas (poderes especiais) ou AFSPA foi estendida em todo Assam e a faixa de 20 km de largura em Meghalaya, que faz fronteira com o estado por seis meses, com o Centro declarando que o status de "área perturbada", em vigor desde Em uma notificação, o Ministério do Interior disse que a situação da lei e da ordem em Assam continua sendo motivo de preocupação devido aos incidentes violentos com roupas subterrâneas e, entre janeiro e setembro de 2016, diferentes grupos militantes estiveram envolvidos. incidentes de violência em Assam, que resultaram na morte de 29 pessoas. "Os equipamentos militantes que operam na área continuam fazendo esforços constantes para reagrupar, re-fortalecer e intensificar seus esforços para recrutar / infiltração de novos quadros no estado e conceder em extorsão coercitiva visando empresários, proprietários de jardins de chá, empreiteiros, veículos comerciais, contrabandistas de madeira, transportadores e até funcionários e políticos do governo. "United National A Frente de Libertação do Sudeste da Ásia Ocidental (UNLFW) foi formada em abril de 2015, e dois de seus constituintes, ULFA (I) e NDFB (S), têm se esforçado desesperadamente para perpetrar atos demonstrativos de violência e durante o ano em que eles Segundo o comunicado, a notificação emitida pelo secretário conjunto do Ministério do Interior, Satyendra Garg, foi responsável por 57% dos incidentes de violência e 84% das mortes no estado. Os militantes do NDFB (S) mataram 14 civis e ficaram feridos 19 outros em um mercado local movimentado nos arredores da cidade de Kokrajhar em 5 de agosto de 2016, enquanto os quadros da ULFA (I) também mataram duas pessoas de língua hindi no distrito de Tinsukia e orquestraram cinco e duas explosões de IED nos distritos de Tinsukia e Charaideo, respectivamente , em 12 de agosto de 2016. "Agora, portanto, todo o estado de Assam e a faixa de 20 km de largura no estado de Meghalaya, na fronteira com Assam, continuarão a ser 'áreas perturbadas', conforme a Seção 3 da Lei das Forças Armadas (Poderes Especiais) , 1958 até seis meses depois de 3 de novembro de 2016, a menos que seja retirado mais cedo ", afirmou. O governo central impôs pela primeira vez a Lei das Forças Armadas (Poderes Especiais) - AFSPA - em Assam, declarando todo o estado como" área perturbada "em Em 27 de novembro de 1990, quando a insurgência liderada pela ULFA estava no auge. O então presidente Asom Gana Parishad, liderado por Prafulla Kumar Mahanta ou o governo AGP, foi posteriormente demitido pelo Centro e o governo foi imposto. está coordenando a ação conjunta com outras roupas subterrâneas, incluindo NSCN (K) e KYKL, ao longo da fronteira de Arunachal Pradesh-Mianmar e com o GNLA e HNLC ao longo da fronteira de Meghalaya-Bangladesh, também fornecendo treinamento aos quadros do KPLT / UPLA em seus campos em Mianmar. roupas militantes, como UPLA, UKPLA e várias facções da KPLT, estiveram ativamente envolvidas em extorsão e seqüestro por resgate nos distritos montanhosos de Karbi Anglong e Dima Hasao; e as áreas de fronteira montanhosas e densamente arborizadas de Assam fornecem um local adequado para acampamentos / abrigos / esconderijos para ULFA (I), NDFB (S), NSCN (IM), NSCN (K), GNLA KPLT e vários equipamentos e quadros subterrâneos Meitei dessas roupas aproveitam a travessia para estados vizinhos para evitar ações das forças de segurança, disse o documento. translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= South Africa's industry hurt by cold-rolled steel imports - ITAC Mon Nov 7, 2016 1:22pm Imports of cold-rolled steel products, particularly from China, are hurting South African producers, initial findings from a local trade agency showed on Monday, potentially paving the way for import duties. The International Trade Administration of South Africa launched an investigation in July into whether to impose safeguard duties on imports of cold-rolled steel from a number of countries including China at the request of steel maker ArcelorMittal South Africa. South Africa had previously said it is considering imposing emergency tariffs on some iron and steel imports in a filing to the World Trade Organization. (Reporting by Nqobile Dludla; Editing by Tiisetso Motsoeneng)
pre_translation_body: South Africa's industry hurt by cold-rolled steel imports - ITAC Mon Nov 7, 2016 1:22pm Imports of cold-rolled steel products, particularly from China, are hurting South African producers, initial findings from a local trade agency showed on Monday, potentially paving the way for import duties. The International Trade Administration of South Africa launched an investigation in July into whether to impose safeguard duties on imports of cold-rolled steel from a number of countries including China at the request of steel maker ArcelorMittal South Africa. South Africa had previously said it is considering imposing emergency tariffs on some iron and steel imports in a filing to the World Trade Organization. (Reporting by Nqobile Dludla; Editing by Tiisetso Motsoeneng)
body: A indústria da África do Sul foi afetada pelas importações de aço laminado a frio - ITAC Segunda-feira, 7 de novembro de 2016 13:22 As importações de produtos de aço laminado a frio, principalmente da China, estão prejudicando os produtores sul-africanos, mostraram as primeiras conclusões de uma agência de comércio local na segunda-feira, potencialmente preparando o caminho para os direitos de importação. A Administração de Comércio Internacional da África do Sul iniciou uma investigação em julho sobre a imposição de direitos de salvaguarda às importações de aço laminado a frio de vários países, incluindo a China, a pedido da siderúrgica ArcelorMittal África do Sul. A África do Sul havia dito anteriormente que está considerando a possibilidade de impor tarifas de emergência sobre algumas importações de ferro e aço em um documento apresentado à Organização Mundial do Comércio. (Reportagem de Nqobile Dludla; Edição de Tiisetso Motsoeneng)

translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= Close Image 1 of 2 Michigan guard Derrick Walton Jr. (10) looks to pass the ball as he is defended by Howard guard Ausar Madison (4) in the first half of an NCAA college basketball game at Crisler Center in Ann Arbor, Mich., Friday, Nov. 11, 2016. less Michigan guard Derrick Walton Jr. (10) looks to pass the ball as he is defended by Howard guard Ausar Madison (4) in the first half of an NCAA college basketball game at Crisler Center in Ann Arbor, Mich., ... more Photo: Tony Ding, AP Image 2 of 2 Michigan forward Moritz Wagner (13), of Germany, gets fouled attempting a shot under the basket by Howard forward Solomon Mangham (12), in the first half of an NCAA college basketball game in Ann Arbor, Mich., Friday, Nov. 11, 2016. less Michigan forward Moritz Wagner (13), of Germany, gets fouled attempting a shot under the basket by Howard forward Solomon Mangham (12), in the first half of an NCAA college basketball game in Ann Arbor, Mich., ... more Photo: Tony Ding, AP Michigan pulls away in second half to beat Howard 76-58 1 / 2 Back to Gallery ANN ARBOR, Mich. (AP) — Derrick Walton scored 14 of his 20 points in the first half, and Michigan fought through a tough shooting night to beat Howard 76 -58 on Friday. The Wolverines went over five minutes without scoring at the beginning of the game, and they ended up shooting just 42 percent from the field. The Bison trailed 41-36 with under 12 minutes remaining in the game before Michigan pulled away. Mark Donnal scored 12 points for Michigan, and Zak Irvin added 11. Damon Collins scored 12 points for Howard, which was without guard James Daniel , the nation's leading scorer last season. He is expected to miss about another month with a high ankle sprain. Free throws helped boost Michigan's margin in a foul-filled game. The Wolverines went 23 of 26 from the line, while Howard was just 14 of 29. Michigan's scoreless stretch to open the game was finally broken when Muhammad-Ali Abdur-Rahkman made a couple 3-pointers. The Wolverines led 34-25 at halftime. It was 41-36 when Howard's Solomon Mangham missed two free throws. Irvin made a jumper at the other end, and Michigan slowly began extending the lead. It was 49-38 after a 3-pointer by Irvin. Most Read

body: Fechar Imagem 1 de 2 O guarda de Michigan Derrick Walton Jr. (10) parece passar a bola enquanto é defendido pelo guarda de Howard Ausar Madison (4) na primeira metade de um jogo de basquete da NCAA no Crisler Center, em Ann Arbor, Michigan. , Sexta-feira, 11 de novembro de 2016. menos O guarda Derrick Walton Jr. (10) do Michigan parece passar a bola enquanto é defendido pelo guarda Ausar Madison (4) de Howard na primeira metade de um jogo de basquete universitário da NCAA no Crisler Center, em Ann Arbor, Mich., ... mais Foto: Tony Ding, AP Imagem 2 de 2 O atacante do Michigan Moritz Wagner (13), da Alemanha, é derrubado tentando um chute embaixo da cesta pelo atacante Howard Solomon Mangham (12), no primeira metade de um jogo de basquete universitário da NCAA em Ann Arbor, Michigan, sexta-feira, 11 de novembro de 2016. menos O atacante do Michigan Moritz Wagner (13), da Alemanha, é derrubado ao tentar chutar debaixo da cesta pelo avançado Howard Solomon Mangham (12) ), na primeira metade de um jogo de basquete universitário da NCAA em Ann Arbor, Michigan, ... mais Foto: Tony Ding, AP Michigan se afasta no segundo tempo para vencer Howard 76-58 1/2 Voltar à Galeria ANN ARBOR, Michigan (AP) - Derrick Walton marcou 14 de seus 20 pontos no primeiro tempo, e Michigan lutou por uma noite difícil para vencer Howard 76 - 58 na sexta-feira. Os Wolverines passaram cinco minutos sem marcar no início do jogo e acabaram atirando em apenas 42% do campo. O Bison perdeu 41-36 com menos de 12 minutos restantes no jogo antes de Michigan se afastar. Mark Donnal marcou 12 pontos para o Michigan e Zak Irvin adicionou 11. Damon Collins marcou 12 pontos para Howard, que estava sem o guarda James Daniel, o maior artilheiro do país na última temporada. Ele deve perder mais um mês com uma entorse no tornozelo. Lances livres ajudaram a aumentar a margem de Michigan em um jogo cheio de falta. Os Wolverines foram 23 dos 26 da linha, enquanto Howard tinha apenas 14 dos 29. O trecho sem gols de Michigan para abrir o jogo foi finalmente quebrado quando Muhammad-Ali Abdur-Rahkman fez três pontos. Os Wolverines lideraram 34-25 no intervalo. Era 41-36 quando Solomon Mangham, de Howard, perdeu dois lances livres. Irvin saltou do outro lado e Michigan lentamente começou a aumentar a vantagem. Foi 49-38 depois de um ponteiro de 3 por Irvin. translator_query: https://translate.google.com/#view=home&op=translate&sl=en&tl=pt&text= KRIV-TV reporter Scarlett Fakhar under fire for pro-Trump... "This wasn't going to be our forever," Heather Werdal said. Hayden — who is nearly 6-foot-4, with dark hair, blue eyes and a quick smile — was 13 in October 2014 when he got what his mom thought was just a nasty cold. Within a week, he had a stiff neck and tingling hands and feet. Two days later, his neck couldn't support his head. Within weeks, he was paralyzed, breathing with the help of a ventilator. "We thought we were going to lose him," Heather Werdal recalled. The eventual diagnosis was AFM, which appears to start with a common respiratory illness, but quickly leads to devastating and possibly permanent paralysis. "We had no idea a cold could do this," said Heather Werdal. Mom tracks new cases Hayden was part of a surge in AFM cases in 2014 — at least 120 between August and December that year in 34 states, according to the CDC. That included two confirmed cases in Washington. There were far fewer in 2015, just 21 in 16 states. But this year it's up again. Even as Heather Werdal has followed the new cases reported in Washington, she has been tracking a spike in numbers on a closed Facebook page for families of kids with the neurologic disorder. "We're getting this huge influx," she said. "It's probably 10 a week from all over the country." That anecdotal evidence mirrors cases documented by the CDC, which has confirmed 89 cases in 33 states this year between January and September. CDC and state officials acknowledge they haven't been able to pinpoint the cause of AFM, which is characterized not only by limb weakness, but by distinctive lesions that attack the gray matter of the spinal cord. Cases are confirmed through symptoms and specific findings from magnetic resonance imaging, or MRI, said Dr. Scott Lindquist , the Washington state epidemiologist for infectious disease. Officials in Washington state and at the CDC are intensifying the investigation. A CDC epidemic intelligence service officer will review every detail of the eight regional AFM cases, interviewing families for any potential clues. "That's where we're at in this investigation, gathering more data," Lindquist said. Parents are understandably worried, but there's no specific action known to prevent AFM. Doctors urge typical steps to prevent illness, including frequent hand-washing, avoiding sick people and cleaning any potentially contaminated surfaces. "Sick from a cold" Dr. Susan Apkon , director of rehabilitation medicine at Seattle Children's, treated Hayden for several months in 2014. "I think what's important to convey is that AFM is not in itself a virus," she said. "It is not contagious. It is an incredibly rare result of a contagious viral infection." In Hayden's case, the whole family got sick, including his brother, Evan, now 16, who did not develop AFM. Heather Werdal said she believes Hayden and the others may have genetic or other predispositions that may make them vulnerable to AFM. "We think there's something unique in our kids' DNA that triggers this," she said. Whatever the cause, AFM has dramatically altered the Werdal family's life. Hayden requires 24-hour care, with two day nurses and a night nurse, in addition to his family. Hayden's father, Jeff Werdal , 44, is an IT systems analyst with the City of Bellevue, a position with good health-care coverage. But costs are high, so the family has a GoFundMe fundraising page to help with expenses. Hayden's needs have included a motorized wheelchair and the ongoing costs of the physical therapy and occupational therapy that appear to be helping his recovery. "Four months ago, he did not have respiratory support muscles," said Kristi van Niel , the occupational therapist who works with Hayden twice a week. Now, they're getting stronger, which means Hayden is progressing toward breathing on his own. Hayden himself is matter-of-fact about his condition. He's back in class as a freshman at Central Kitsap High School , where he's taking three classes and hopes to catch up with his classmates. When friends ask, he tells them: "I just got sick from a cold." He's a fan of all video games, including "the scary ones." And he went to the recent homecoming dance. "We said, 'Did you dance?'" his mother recalled. "He said, 'I wiggled.'" Hayden said he has days when he gets "mopey," but he tries to follow the advice of his uncle, who is also a quadriplegic. "He says, 'Suck it up,'" Hayden said, grinning. No one knows when — or if — Hayden will recover full movement, but his mother said he's determined to regain as much as he can. "We told him we're going to figure out a life for him," she said. "We didn't see this as the worst thing in the world." ___
